oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nephrotoxicity of Narthecium ossifragum in cattle in Norway
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Flåøyen, A.
Binde, M.
Bratberg, B.
Djønne, B.
Fjølstad, M.
Grønstøl, H.
Hassan, H.
Mantle, P. G.
Landeverk, T.
Schönheit, J.
Tønnesen, M. H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: renal failure
depression
anorexia
blood in the faeces
diarrhoea
diarrhea
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During the summer of 1992 renal failure was diagnosed in 232 grazing cattle in 85 herds on the west coast of Norway. The salient clinical signs were depression, anorexia and melaena or fresh blood in the faeces; diarrhoea was also commonly observed. Full article published in Veterinary Record (1995) 137, 259-263
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1995; 176
